definition: to read again/to review (a lesson etc)
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
comma/phrase marked by pause

sentences.english: I've read and re-read the book, but it won't go in.
sentences.chinese: 我一读再读这本书，但就是不得其要领。

sentences.english: He remembers that he watched the movie first, then read the book.
sentences.chinese: 他还记得自己是先看了电影之后再读的原著。

sentences.english: Reading to a reading of detail futzing, fun.
sentences.chinese: 愿一读再读，细细把玩，趣味无穷。

sentences.english: Youth is a book too hasty, our tears, read it again and again.
sentences.chinese: 青春是一本太仓促的书，我们含着泪，一读再读。

definition: stress (on a syllable)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
comma/phrase marked by pause
(polite) to read (sth)
read-only (computing)
to read (honorific: e.g. your distinguished article)
to read a book/to study/to attend school
impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
to write
intensive reading/to peruse/perusal
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into
colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write
extensive reading
Guwen Guanzhi, an anthology of essays written in Literary Chinese, compiled and edited by Wu Chucai and Wu Diaohou of Qing dynasty
masterpiece
reader/an instructional book
